title: Follow up to “I booted Linux 293k times”
dot: digraph G{rankdir=TB;node[shape=record, style=filled, color=lightblue, fontsize=10];A[label="{Start|Notice Linux guest hang in nbdkit tests}"];B[label="{Initial Hypothesis|Suspected qemu bug}"];C[label="{Investigation|Filed bug in qemu, swapped versions}"];D[label="{Realization|Issue likely in Linux guest kernel}"];E[label="{Bisecting Bug|Kernel 6.0 works, 6.4rc hangs}"];F[label="{Challenge|52,363 commits between kernels}"];G[label="{First Attempt|Manual test, wrong commit found}"];H[label="{Second Attempt|Automated test with 8 threads}"];I[label="{Outcome|Still slow, better results}"];J[label="{Parallel Testing|292,612 boots, commit identified}"];K[label="{Final Insight|Commit exposed latent bug}"];L[label="{Community Effort|Amazon, CoreOS developers, Peter Zijlstra}"];M[label="{Resolution|Thomas Gleixner suggests a fix}"];N[label="{Success|Fix tested and worked}"];A->B->C->D->E->F->G->H->I->J->K->L->M->N;subgraph cluster_0{label="Debugging Process";style=dashed;color=gray;A;B;C;D;E;F;G;H;I;J;K;}subgraph cluster_1{label="Community Collaboration";style=dashed;color=gray;L;M;N;}}
